It has been linked to normal limb development, cell proliferation, and early morphogenesis. Its structure and function have also been described during postnatal opossum development and human testicular development.

In light of this information, we can examine the potential choices for derivation from the mesonephros. Paroophoron, vas deferens, epididymis, and glomerulus are all structures that have been associated with the reproductive system or kidney development.
